last_episode_to_air.name: The Opening Act
last_episode_to_air.overview: A promoter books the brothers on a heavy radio tour schedule, while trying to find an opening act for their upcoming concert.

name: The Jackson 5ive
overview: The Jackson 5ive was a Saturday morning cartoon series produced by Rankin/Bass and Motown Productions on ABC from September 11, 1971 until 14 October 1972; a fictionalized portrayal of the careers of Motown recording group The Jackson 5. The series was rebroadcast in syndication through Worldvision Enterprises during the 1984â€“1985 Saturday morning season, during a period when Michael Jackson was riding a major wave of popularity as a solo artist. The series was animated mainly in London at the studios of Halas and Batchelor, and some animation done at Estudios Moro, Barcelona, Spain. The director was Spanish-American Robert Balser.

episodes.name: It All Started With...
episodes.overview: The alleged story of how Diana Ross discovered The    Jackson 5,we all know who originally discovered them.   Anyway,the story begins when Ms. Ross finds a pink    snake in her dressing room,which turns out to be    Rosey,the brothers' pet snake.Fearing that something    bad will happen to Rosey,Michael gets on his bike    and heads down to the arena,Marlon,Jermaine,Tito,   and Jackie follow him in Tito's old beat-up car.   After getting Rosey out of harm's way,Michael and    his brothers become fast friends with Ms. Ross and    later on she discovers how talented they are and    invites them to Detroit,MI for an audition with her    record company (Motown),but the brothers have other    ambitions:Jackie wants to be pro-basketball player,   Tito wants to design and build cars,Jermaine wants    to be a chef,Marlon wants to be a scientist,and    Michael hopes to be a cowboy and run his own ranch.   After sleeping on it,the Jackson 5 decides to head    to Detroit to make music.

episodes.name: Pinestock, U.S.A.
episodes.overview: The Jackson 5 head out to the country to perform a    concert in the wilderness.This concert is promoted    by a greedy millionaire named,Mr. Carruthers,who    plans to have all the trees cut down before the big    show.But the brothers are so concerned about the    animals in the forest that they feel that what Mr.   Carruthers is doing is wrong,so when they get wise    on Mr. Carruthers' plans,he decides to have his    lumberjacks put the J5 in a deep,dark cave where    water begins to leak into the cave,but thanks to    Ray & Charles (with help from some moles),the brothers escaped unharmed and plan to get revenge on    Mr. Carruthers and his lumberjacks.

episodes.name: Drafted
episodes.overview: The Jackson 5 prepare for a concert at Fort Paratroop.Michael and Marlon decides to march with    some inductees and gets (accidently) inducted to the    service.Jackie,Tito,and Jermaine must find a way to    get their younger brothers out before their show.

episodes.name: Mistaken Identity
episodes.overview: The Jacksons are heading to Las Vegas for a big show,    on the way, they make a pit stop at an old printing    place to have some posters printed up for their show.   But the guy that Jackie hired must've had his wires    crossed because he stuck their picture to a wanted    poster for another group of brothers called,The    Dingbats, who are mean-spirted crooks.

episodes.name: Bongo, Baby, Bongo
episodes.overview: While the J5 are rehearsing for a concert in the park,a crooked clown kidnaps a bongo playing monkey    and takes him to the circus for his own greedy purposes.Meanwhile,the monkey' mother is furious to    find her baby's gone and takes Michael hostage and    forces him to play the bongos for her.It's up to Jackie,Tito,Marlon,and Jermaine to go to the circus    and get the monkey back to the zoo before they lose Michael forever.

episodes.name: The Winners' Circle
episodes.overview: Visiting a race track, Michael is tricked by a somewhat shifty horse racer into accidentally buying a lazy, unmotivated horse. When the brothers learn that the horse can race real fast when their music is being played, the horse racer comes up with a plan to make sure they lose everything.

episodes.name: CinderJackson
episodes.overview: Mr. Leo King,a show business entrepeneur,has plans to make a film starring Samantha Christie,the Princess of Pop and makes an announcement that he plans to    throw a fabulous birthday for Samantha,where she'll    get to choose the leading man for her film.It's  Michael's big dream come true,but unfortunately,he's    very sick and is unable to attend the party,that is    until a package from Gary,IN shows up at his door    step.What Michael thought was chicken soup,turned    out to be his hairy godfather,who helps him get    geared up for the ball.First,he gets rid Michael's    cold,second,he decks him out in fresh threads and    glass sneakers,transforms an anchovie pizza pie into    a limosuine,and Ray,Charles,and Rosey into Michael's   servants,then he's off to the ball.

episodes.name: The Wizard of Soul
episodes.overview: Michael wanders into an oasis called the Land of Soul he sees each of his brothers play a familiar Wizard of Oz character. Together they journey to find the "Wizard of Soul," who if located can help him get back to his (real) brothers and get to the show on time.

episodes.name: The Tiny Five
episodes.overview: The Jacksons are shrunk to miniature size and have to avoid large household perils to reverse the mishap that miniaturized them.

episodes.name: The Groovatron
episodes.overview: Marlon and Michael create a funky-dancing musical robot called ""The J5 Groovatron"",then they meet a salesman named Sam Sham,who offers the brothers some finishing touches for the Groovatron,but after seeing its test run,Sam Sham steals the funky robot and makes millions off of it.It's up to the Jackson 5 to get their Groovatron robot back from Sam Sham before they end up unemployed.

episodes.name: Ray & Charles: Superstars
episodes.overview: While taking a break from doing a commercial,Marlon and Michael visit a cartoon studio where a cartoonist is trying draw mice for an animated version of ""The Prince and the Pauper"",then he asks if he could use Ray and Charles for the movie.At first,Michael and Marlon refuses,but realizes that they were selfish and let them do the cartoon,but will success go to Ray's and Charles's heads?

episodes.name: Farmer Jacksons
episodes.overview: The brothers take some time off and buy some farmland from a guy named Shtook and meet an indian named Running Water and the J5 has only a few days (or weeks) to make something out of the land they bought or they'll lose everything.

episodes.name: Jackson Island
episodes.overview: On a flight to Hawaii, the five brothers crash onto an island. Michael hits his head on a coconut and meets the most fictional and evil pirates in history.

episodes.name: The Michael Look
episodes.overview: When stranded without his stage clothing in a travel mishap at Heathrow Airport in London, Michael unwisely consults two envious Pearly Kings threatened by his success who use the opportunity to plot to discredit him. The two Pearlies conspire to trick Michael into dressing in shabby patches and rags for his royal performance, but once he is seen on Carnaby Street, his look becomes a British fashion sensation.

episodes.name: Jackson Street, U.S.A.
episodes.overview: The J5 has been invited back to Gary,Indiana by the Mayor for that   he wants to name a street after the hit-making sibling group. But,Michael gets Marlon,Jackie,Tito,   and Jermaine in tons of mischief not realizing after all they've been through that they're a week early for their induction.

episodes.name: Rasho-Jackson
episodes.overview: The J5's producer (Berry Gordy) tries to figure out why neither of the brothers are talking to each other.Each had their own different side of the story to tell.All claim that they helped a young girl who ran out of gas,each one saying that they did it themselves and trying to top the other's side of the story.But their producer tries to smooth things over and get them back together.

episodes.name: A Rare Pearl
episodes.overview: After a series of unsuccessful dates,the J5 decides to swear off girls for good.On flight to Detroit,The brothers meets new flight attendent,Jacqualine Pearl and fall head over heels in love with her,so when they arrive in Detroit,she writes a letter,each of them thinking its for them only.All the guys call her one by one for dates,feeling that they're puuting her on,she asks her brother,Jumbo for help to set up a trap for all the Jackson 5.

episodes.name: Who's Hoozis?
episodes.overview: The Jacksons are scheduled to perform at an outdoor concert, but when Michael discovers a talking "blues bird" (a play on "blues" and bluebird) and learns that the jazz-musician voiced bird and his nest, containing an egg soon to hatch, are in danger from bulldozers scheduled to tear down the concert park, Michael investigates. He learns a wealthy magnate named Hoozis owns the building overlooking the endangered park, and at once moves in to interfere. Hoozis is patterned after eccentric U.S. millionaire Howard Hughes.

episodes.name: Michael White
episodes.overview: When he bumps his head in a bicycling accident, Michael dreams he is a storybook prince hiding in a tiny cottage where his brothers are dwarf-sized and warn him not to eat the poisoned apple a visiting crone soon offers (as in the story of Snow White). Naturally, Michael bites the apple and immediately collapses as though dead.

episodes.name: Groove to the Chief
episodes.overview: Michael fantasizes about what it would be like to become Mayor of Los Angeles. His Hairy Godfather (back from the episode "CinderJackson") grants his wish and Michael discovers that it's a bigger job than he thought. The Hairy Godfather is the only character to play a recurring role in The Jackson 5ive besides Berry Gordy.

episodes.name: Michael in Wonderland
episodes.overview: Before a show in the Wonderland theme park, Michael accidentally falls unconscious while testing a new roller coaster ride and dreams he is in Wonderland, where he encounters soul and funk-related versions of Wonderland's famous characters.

episodes.name: Jackson and the Beanstalk
episodes.overview: Michael comes across magic beans that grow a beanstalk outside his and his brothers' Indiana apartment (as in the story of Jack and the Beanstalk). When he climbs to the top, he wanders a fabulous land and encounters the giant.

episodes.name: The Opening Act
episodes.overview: A promoter books the brothers on a heavy radio tour schedule, while trying to find an opening act for their upcoming concert.
